title.narrative: Feeding Training for Kazakhstan's Children with Disabilities

description.narrative: In June 2014, SPOON facilitated a two-day centralized training in Almaty Oblast on a range of nutrition-related topics for CWD, including complications associated with feeding CWD and strategies to address them, and identifying needs for specialized feeding equipment and utensils. The training included a hands-on component to demonstrate proper positioning, bottle, spoon and cup feeding for children unable to feed themselves independently. Participants included MoH officials, physicians and social workers from Rehab Hospitals, chief nurses and dietitians of Baby Homes from the Almaty region and Astana city, and members of Public Organizations supporting CWD. This workshop provided the space for people with decision-making roles to come together and discuss the training model and opportunities for incorporating this model into existing training programs or systems. SPOON is planning to return to Kazakhstan to leverage the success of this training with additional capacity development and technical support.

This project aims to build in-country technical capacity of service and care providers who work with children with disabilities (CWD) and their families by creating and delivering a culturally appropriate training curriculum package.
